Course Description

This course covers the fundamental principles of accessible web development, including WCAG 2.1 guidelines, semantic HTML, ARIA attributes, and inclusive design practices. Students will learn to create websites that are usable by everyone, regardless of ability or assistive technology used.

Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, students will be able to:

  1. Understand WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards and levels (A, AA, AAA)
  2. Write semantic HTML that supports assistive technologies
  3. Implement ARIA attributes appropriately
  4. Test websites for accessibility using automated and manual tools
  5. Design inclusive user experiences

Required Materials

  • Textbook: "Web Accessibility: A Foundation" (Available at university bookstore)
  • Web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge)
  • Code editor (VS Code recommended)
  • Screen reader software (NVDA or JAWS)

Assignments submitted late will receive a 10% deduction per day, up to 3 days. No work accepted after 3 days.
